title: My Belgian Telco provider claims they enabled VoLTE and Wifi calling. However, both are disabled
content:
Hi,

My Belgian Telco provider claims they enabled VoLTE and Wifi calling. However, both options are still disabled (*#*#4636#*#*). My Telco provider claims this is because my phone does not support VoLTE and Wifi calling.

Indeed, officially my Telco provider only sports iPhones and several models from Samsung and Huawei; not Pixels (which, I have to add, cannot be bought in Belgium; I ordered mine in Germany).

When I put my sim in my wife's iPhone, VoLTE indeed gets enabled but Wifi calling does not (which does work through her Telco provider which is different from mine).

The above - as far as VoLTE is concerned; we cannot draw any conclusions for Wifi calling - makes me wonder:  does a Telco provider know what phone you're using and can they enable features based on the phone you're using?
OR
Do I need any Telco specific firmware and/or config on my Pixel in order for VoLTE to work? And if so, what would I need to request from my Telco provider in order for that firmware and/or config to make it onto my phone?

Thanks a lot in advance for anyone who can provide any clues!

Ren√©
category: Contacts, Calls, Voicemail, Google Pixel 4 XL
